title: Authors and Citation
text: Ramasamy J (2023). MetabolicSyndrome: Diagnosis Metabolic Syndrome. R package version 0.1.3, https://github.com/jagadishramasamy/metsynd.
code: @Manual{,   title = {MetabolicSyndrome: Diagnosis of Metabolic Syndrome},   author = {Jagadish Ramasamy},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.1.3},   url = {https://github.com/jagadishramasamy/metsynd}, }

title: Diagnosis of Metabolic Syndrome
text: modified Adult Treatment Panel -III guidelines (ATP-III) proposed American Heart Association (AHA) National Heart, Lung Blood Institute (NHLBI) used widely clinical diagnosis Metabolic Syndrome. AHA-NHLBI criteria advise using parameters waist circumference (WC), systolic blood pressure (SBP), diastolic blood pressure (DBP), fasting plasma glucose (FPG), triglycerides (TG) high-density lipoprotein cholesterol (HDLC) diagnosis metabolic syndrome. parameter interpreted based proposed cut-offs, making diagnosis slightly complex error-prone. package developed incorporating modified ATP-III guidelines, aid easy quick diagnosis metabolic syndrome busy healthcare settings also research purposes. modified ATP-III-AHA-NHLBI criteria diagnosis described Grundy et al ., (2005) doi:10.1161/CIRCULATIONAHA.105.169404.

title: Diagnosis of Metabolic Syndrome
code: library(MetabolicSyndrome) MetabolicSyndrome(x) # x is the dataframe containing all the parameters required to dignose metabolic syndrome.

title: Diagnosis of Metabolic Syndrome
text: Use exact column names specified Gender - Gender Male Female WC -Waist Circumference cm TG - Triglycerides mg/dL HDLC - High Density Lipoprotein Cholesterol mg/dL SBP - Systolic BP mm Hg DBP - Diastolic BP mm Hg FPG - Fasting plasma glucose mg/dL
